page.description: Dynamically sets the columns in a List and populates the List.

argument.name: listId
argument.description: The ID of the List Control.

argument.name: data
argument.description: A JSON object defining the data used to populate the List.

argument.name: options
argument.description: A JSON object with settings. Options can include:

item.name: columnCount
item.description: The number of columns to create. For example, in a set of data with 50 columns, you may only want to show the first 5 columns in the List control.

item.name: columns
item.description: An array listing the fields to use for the List columns.

item.name: returnExpression
item.description: A JavaScript expression that defines what value to return from the List control for the selected row. This expression must prefix column names with 'data'. Eg, *[js:'data.Firstname+" "+data.Lastname']*

item.name: showTitle
item.description: A *[js:true]* or *[js:false]* value. Defines whether or not column titles should be displayed.

page.discussion: The *[js:{dialog.object}.setListColumnsAndPopulate]* method dynamically sets the columns in a List control and populates the List with records defined in the *[js:data]* parameter. The columns are based on the columns in the first row of data.

see.ref: How to Dynamically Populate List Columns and Data
